name: Lankayan Island Dive Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is picture postcard paradise - white sand, crystal sea and nothing for miles. The detached wooden chalets are spacious and well appointed - 4 poster bed, monsoon shower, fridge and air con. Each has a large verandah with seating overlooking the sea (which is about 6 feet from the back door). There is also a hammock and private sunloungers on the beach (although they could do with cushions). The setting is to die for.
reviews.title: A little slice of paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The island is tiny with just 23 chalets. We stayed early February and the weather was sunny and hot with a strong breeze and little humidity. As non-divers we snorkelled - you can do it straight off the island which is great for fish but the coral has seen better days. But they offer boat snorkelling at 50MYR per person and just a 5 minute ride away the coral is great. You can hire snorkelling and diving gear at the jetty.
reviews.title: What a great place, really good rooms and experience
Wonderful relaxation
reviews.text: The island is a very bumpy 90 minute speed boat ride from Sandakan, but on arrival your bags are whisked off to your room and a face towel and fresh juice await to freshen up. The staff are friendly and discreet. We were lucky enough to be there when 97 turtle eggs hatched and a staff member went around the island to gather everyone for their release into the sea - magical. The only disappointment is the food, although plentiful it's a 3 star buffet for lunch and dinner.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a surprise, we didnt expect it to so good, pity we didnt see any turtles but it was magic, we will go again, Room 7 is great.
reviews.title: Pure paradise..... and idyllic honeymoon

reviews.text: My only tip would be, eat early as the they don't always have enough fresh fish from the mainland
reviews.title: Until we return, we will for ever wonder if this was for real
Heaven!
reviews.text: We had an absolutely idyllic stay here on Lankayan and I can honestly say I had a tear in my eye when we left on the speedboat back to Sandakan.

reviews.title: Tropical paradise with fantastic diving
reviews.text: The Island is lush, white sand, blue sea and the bungalows are set all around the edge of the Island giving you privacy from everyone else. We snorkelled each day from our bungalow straight into the sea and saw a multitude of fish, baby sharks etc. I am not a sea baby but I really got over my fear of water here as it was clear and calm and reasonably shallow.

reviews.title: Paradise surely found
reviews.text: The bungalow itself is huge, with a nice patio area and hammock. The beds are really comfortable and there is aircon inside too.

reviews.title: loved it but be warned if you don't like snorkelling, diving or kayaking...
reviews.text: We loved the food here, there was ample choice of western/asian foods, different meats and fish and fresh fruits each meal. The staff were all welcoming and friendly :)

reviews.title: Heaven - there's no other way to describe it!
reviews.text: Our only gripe was finding that people were reserving tables for dinner, which became worse during our stay actually leaving us one night with nowhere to eat. Dinner is served between 7-8pm. It started one night with a group of 4 people who would reserve their table EVERY night (no idea why as they didnt look very important to me) and as the nights went on, 8 tables were then reserved. We found this to be really unfair, especially if we arrived for dinner at 7pm, and they arrived closer to 8pm. The staff need to look into this, because Lankayan is visited by alot of couples, and it was the couples who were left with nowhere to eat.

Was in total awe from the moment I stepped off the boat. Granted I am not quite used to this kind of luxury, but I thought it was completely magical! The cabins are beautiful, we had one with a separate bedroom (4 poster bed), plus 2 single beds in the common area, great bathroom too. A fridge is also in the room, so feel free to bring the beverage of your choice (we bought a slab of beer with no issues from the staff). Breath taking beach in front of the cabin, equipped with sunloungers and hammock. Loved the snorkelling. The staff were super friendly (and great singers!), lots of fun and very informative, esp about the turtle rehabilitation programs on the island. Food just got better by each meal, everytime something innovative and different. Wish I stayed longer. 3 nights not enough. Would love to go back.
reviews.title: Brilliant, so beautiful, luxurious, fun and wicked food!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ah, Lankayan. We stayed here for five nights and wow, what a fabulous experience. After a bracing, scenic 80-minute speedboat ride, you arrive at a lush and lovely green speck in the middle of the Sulu Sea. You can literally walk around the island in twenty minutes—and that includes posing for a picture with the heavily-armed military police. Anyway, after docking at the sturdy, well-designed pier, you’re hustled off to the restaurant for a glass of watered-down Ribena (?), the signing of liability forms and a surprisingly martial “island rules” lecture by a humorless Napoleonic divemaster. This was greatly amusing.
reviews.title: Unique snorkeling, great rooms, perfect beach and many, many turtles...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: “There are three activities on Lankayan: snorkeling, kayaking and walking on the beach—and walking on the beach is forbidden after seven!”
reviews.title: Excellent - but not quite the Maldives!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After being so berated for crimes not yet committed we were led to a detached beachside chalet which exceeded expectations. Airy, tastefully decorated, powerful ceiling fan, air-conditioning, excellent bath with two— count them— shower nozzles, good water pressure, equipment drying area, mini fridge capable of making ice (!), in-room safe, plenty of storage, mirrors, tables, chairs, wefty towels, kettle for tea and coffee—the works. Outside was even better with a shady porch fronting a floury, white-sand beach, sun-loungers, cozy nap-able hammock, foot-rinse bucket and a clothesline. Some of the other chalets were even closer to the water than ours but we preferred the privacy of being slightly tucked amongst the trees. On a side note, two computers are available for rent by the hour and free wi-fi is available around the lobby. The small store sells basics like t-shirts, aloe vera, sunscreen, books and ice-cream. Laundry service is available by request but not listed.
reviews.title: A beautiful island

reviews.text: The food is served buffet-style (which we were getting a bit tired of by this stage of the trip) but it was overall very tasty and nourishing even for my wife the increasingly put-upon vegetarian. Breakfast was a choice of wonderful fruit, toast, pre-made croissants and pastry, fried noodles, beef bacon or sausages (no pork) potent coffee, watery ribena or tang in place of juice (insert frowny-face emoticon here), make-your-own waffles and an eggs-to-order station. Lunch and dinners offered a range of different vegetables (please, God, no more choi), inventive salads, fresh fruit, rice or noodles and at least three different types of meat dishes. The chicken was generally excellent as was the prawn, calamari and beef offerings though strangely the fish was often overcooked and/or dry. To clear the air on beverages: each chalet has a small fridge which you can stock yourself by purchasing drinks at the restaurant. Those on offer during our stay included Coke, Sprite, carbonated rainbow horrors, bizzaro mango and papaya juice-drinks (now with jellied chunks!) Guinness, Tiger, Carlsberg, Heineken, several different red wines and a selection of any white you like as long as it’s Chardonnay. Be forewarned, the staff will not sell you booze if you’re about to dive (and I’m not sure they will allow you to take it to your room either). Happily, both my wife and I are *merely* snorkelers, plus we smuggled in a bottle of duty-free vodka which we combined into cocktails with the aforementioned soft drinks to mixed success. Luckily, Napoleon the Dive Commander never found us out—though he did kick us off the pier one night for walking after seven (to protect the nesting turtles, he advised us, before continuing up the beach with his friend).
reviews.title: Idyllic Island but diving is average.
A special place to stay
reviews.text: Incredible setting, your own beautiful chalet with 4 posterbed, a hammock infront and straight on to the beach. There is really good snorkelling straight out from the rooms and down by the jetty. We did have a day though when the jellyfish were everywhere and instead went out on a boat to snorkel at a sand bar further out ( no jellyfish there). Food very good, helpful staff. We just went to relax and it is perfect for that ( though I know the divers had a fantastic time as well). You can walk round the island in 10mins which is lovely you feel like you have the place to yourselves. We thought this place was amazing - very luxurious.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Lankayan Island Dive Resort for 3 nights in early May. What an incredible experience. We were pampered and left alone at the same time!
reviews.title: Blue water paradise in the middle of nowhere!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Cabanas: There are 23 beachfront cabanas with A/C. We stayed in #15, which was very romantic and comfortable. It was great to turn off my cell phone and computer for the entire stay! One little thing: the A/C is not really able to keep the room super cold, but it is comfortable for sleeping.
reviews.title: a little piece of paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Diving: Lots of dive sites, and the guests are the only divers out there. They have a maximum of 10 divers/boat, and do a good job of making sure everyone is safe. Also, they lock up the guest's gear at night!
reviews.title: Paradise couldn't be better!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Island: Wow, this is an amazing paradise. I wish we had booked a longer stay. We saw turtles hatch, had amazing diving and snorkeling whenever we wanted. The water was stunningly blue, and the reef is coming back. The water is very warm, and the thermocline is refreshing. Snorkeling is equally amazing. Turtles are prevalent, as are lots of different fish and marine life.
reviews.title: Paradise Island of the Sula Sea

description: A jewel like tiny island in the Sulu Sea, an hour and a half boat rides north of Sandakan; Lankayan has been declared part of an immense Marine Protected Area to adopt the eco-tourism concept. Unpopulated and covered by thick tropical island vegetation on its topside, this peaceful, untouched little bit of paradise is ringed by an endless pure of white sandy beach, offering simply elegant and exquisite accommodation.
